column1: Art Institute of Chicago////Given the intriguing and self-analytical architecture exhibit on the second floor
column2: why did the AIC pick such a staid and banal architect to design the Modern Wing? Ho hum
column3: I say: this is the sort of set piece that my parents would like. Where's the innovation and forward thinking you want on such a era-defining commission? Alas
column4: he might have captured the moment better than I had figured: this is the museum equivalent of all those bad condo towers that have gone up in the past five years.
